p: Cluster of Differentiation 151 is widely expressed in multiple cell types of normal human tissue ( Sincock et al., 1997). Immunohistochemical staining showed that CD151 was found to be strongly positive in the lungs, specifically in airway smooth muscle ( Qiao et al., 2017), epithelial layers, endothelial cells and blood vessels ( Sincock et al., 1997). Given its abundance in lung tissue, the role of CD151 in normal and pathological processes in airways is especially relevant.
